alert.note: Alert for Beaufort; Northern Craven (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 28 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Craven, southeastern Pitt and southwestern Beaufort Counties through 945 PM EDT... At 900 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Shelmerdine, or 7 miles east of Ayden, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Washington, River Road, Blounts Creek, Vanceboro, Shelmerdine, Calico, Black Jack, Wilmar, Edward, Bunyan, Cox Crossroads, Bonnerton, Core Point, Bayview, Aurora Ferry Terminal, Goose Creek State Park, Chocowinity, Washington Park and Gardnerville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
